intro: Sisymbrium vineale, commonly known as field pennycress, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate leaves that are lance-shaped with a rough texture. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from late spring to early autumn. The seeds are small and contain compounds that have been studied for their potential in agriculture and medicine.
